Activity: Log in, coffee, emails. Briefly review yesterday's environmental model progress.
Import the character blockout (FBX) into Maya. Begin the rigging process by creating the initial joint chain for the character's skeleton. Start with the spine, pelvis, and legs.
Continue adding joints for the arms, hands, neck, and head. Pay close attention to joint placement to ensure natural movement and deformation.
Lunch Break. Head out to a nearby cafe with colleagues.
Start setting up basic Inverse Kinematics (IK) handles for the legs and arms. Test the initial IK setup to ensure it's working correctly.
Continue rigging the characters for animation, paying close attention to joint placement and deformation.
Take a break. Check out a gaming forum to see what people are saying about the latest games.
Add basic control curves to the IK handles and other key joints. Begin testing the character's range of motion. Save the Maya scene and document progress.

Respond to emails, update the project management tool, and prepare for tomorrow's animation tasks. Send email to @tart-1 (Technical Artist) to discuss the rigging plan and resolve any issues early on.
